title.rendered: Former business partner’s case against Dhoni

content.rendered:
Former Indian captain Mahendra Singh DhoniFile photo

A defamation case has been filed against India’s World Cup-winning captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni. The case was filed in the Delhi High Court by his two former business partners, Mihir Diwakar and Soumya Das, who are also husband and wife. In the suit, a permanent injunction has been sought against Dhoni, various social media platforms and media houses to stop the plaintiffs from defaming and defaming them.

The Times of India reported that the hearing of the defamation case against Dhoni is scheduled for Thursday.

Earlier, Dhoni filed a cheating case against Mihir and Soumya in Ranchi lower court. In the case, the former Indian captain alleged that the defendants violated the contract to establish the cricket academy and caused a loss of around Rs 16 crore. Mihir and Soumya are directors of a sports management company called ‘Arka Sports’.

As per Dhoni’s claim, an agreement was signed between Arca Sports and Dhoni to launch a cricket academy in 2017. According to the agreement, Arca Sports is obligated to pay a franchise fee and profit sharing. But despite repeated reminders, the company and the accused did not honor the agreement.Read moreBenzema sued the French interior minister

At that time Dhoni’s friend Simeon Lohani filed a complaint against Diwakar for threatening him.

Tomorrow will give a glimpse of where the situation is going in the counter-argument. The defamation case against Dhoni will be heard in the court of Justice Pratibha M Singh.
